comments:
Problem: Errors and exceptions in log if you try create a C++ project with 
same name/different case. 
After this error, if you add then a unique name in the same C++ Project Wizard 
Dialog, and press Finish Button, application might not responde anymore.
This is not repro consistent,  but I could repro a couple of times, when the 
Progress Bar in Project Creation got stuck at 20-30% for >30 minutes, and I 
had to kill the process.

Steps:
1. Create a Managed Make C++ Project named MMPJ, using New->Project wizard. 
Change to C/C++ Perspective.
2. Create another Managed Make C++ Project with the same name but different 
case (e.g. MMPj, using New->Project wizard).
Actual: when you press Finish button in Project wizard you will get an Error 
Message that 'Project cannot be created because a resource already exists with 
different case'
You also get exceptions in log (see below)

3. Press OK in this error dialog, AND in the same New Project dialog append an 
1 to the project name MMPj1 and press again Finish button

Actual: 
This is not repro consistent,  but I could repro a couple of times, when the 
Progress Bar in Project Creation got stuck at 20-30% for >30 minutes, and I 
had to kill the process.
Sometimes is OK and project gets created


Error log:

I've looked at this and the exceptions in the log are by intent. Everything is
handled correctly - we catch the error thrown by the platform, raise the error
dialog and log the message. I wasn't able to reproduce the second failure.

- BG

OK - I'm going to put in a logError parm to the errorDialog call so that clients
can determine if the error needs to be logged.
